name: Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel & Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the restaurant was amazing, the service was spectacular. Excellente restaurant, very romantic for enjoying a dinner night out with your couple. Our waiter, Gaby, was very helpful to us and he made excellent recommendations from the menu. Highly recommended, no regrets.
reviews.title: Choice Rest. Experience

reviews.text: The hotel was under construction when we went, which was very disappointing. However, the rooms, pool and beach area were nice. The room was clean and had a view of the beach. The staff was helpful, and for the rate, it was a good experience.
reviews.title: Good hotel with all you need for an easy PR vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New hotel with small casino and club. Quick cab ride ($15) to Old San Juan. Pool area serves food and waitress was friendly. Infinity pool. Great view. Band at pool played til 3am (private event). Would have been nice to know about this prior to checking in.
reviews.title: New Hotel at Convention Center

reviews.text: Stayed here before and after our Christmas cruise. Great location for cruise departures, as well as access to the private airport and International airport. Because of this, it is a busy. Add in the casino, and the crazy night club and the weekends are BUSY. Don't let the loud lobby scare you, as the floors are very quiet.
reviews.title: Convenient Location, Busy Hotel

reviews.text: Expect slow elevator access are key times. The restaurant is very nice and the breakfasts are quite nice. Expect things to operate a slower pace, so be patient!
reviews.title: Good for business, nice infinity pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a very newly developed area, right next to the convention center. The whole area felt new, clean and safe. The pool area is amazing, HUGE infinity pool, hundreds of sun beds, nice pool bar, very attentive staff and really nice indoor restaurants also. The rooms are beautifully decorated, light, airy, spacious, as is the entire hotel. One night we ate at the little Mexican place, next to the hotel and the fountains (sorry, it's name escapes me!) We will definitely go there again, great food, drinks, service, prices and live music! It's a must! The only negative was that noise really carries in those hotel rooms, maybe it's the new construction? We could hear a service elevator across the hall 24/7 and some guests partying till 4am. I think, when the hotel is not busy , they should try to space guests out better.
reviews.title: Very Nice, New Hotel

reviews.text: I am almost never disappointed with a Sheraton hotel and this one was no difference. I had a fairly large room on the 11th floor with a king size bed facing the convention center and ultimately Old San Juan off in the distance. There is a balcony with two chairs. The hotel itself is nice and fairly new. The casino and the others in San Juan were really nothing to write home about. There were a few table games and then slot machines. No poker. A couple of bars with big screens to watch sports and nice looking pool. The problem is that there is absolutely no where to walk to unless you are going to the convention center. The
reviews.title: Typical Sheraton Quality

reviews.text: Sheraton at Old San Juan is basically across the street from the water and way more convenient to Old San Juan and walking around.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: Great Hotel to stay at. Right next to the convention centre and great restaurants. Nice casino and the best beds ever. Slept like a baby. Staff very knowledgable and friendly. great infinity pool real nice Bar. minutes away from the beach and the tourist areas. all around and absolute great experience. I am usually a Ritz Carlton guy but I am glad I tried the Sheraton they did and outstanding job, Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great rooms and pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the nicer hotels I've stayed in. The staff was friendly but the food was terrible. I was hoping to get a nice tasty authentic experience in the comforts of my room and unfortunately the quality wasn't there. I'm big on food and drink, so it's the first thing I make note of anywhere I'm staying. The pool is huge and sits on top of the roof delivering a nice view of the water and parts of San Juan. Great casino, not too crowded but full of energy. The Bell attendant was very informative and helped point out a few sight seeing options that we took and added adventure to our sight seeing. My wife enjoyed her visit to the spa and we both would come back and recommend this property.
reviews.title: Great location! Great Staff!

reviews.text: My husband and I ate at the choice restaurant in the hotel. The food was fantastic and the waiter went above and beyond to care for us. Gabrielle was our waiter, he made us feel right at home, especially after being on two different fights for 10 hours and only having an apple and hard boiled egg that morning at 0430 and peanuts on the planes throughout due to running from one flight to the other....thank you very much Gabrielle for your kindness!
reviews.title: Excellent customer service!

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights on a recent business trip. The hotel is conveniently located adjacent to the convention center. It's a nice looking hotel. My room was nice and clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff was very friendly. I had a problem with the air conditioner in my room on the day I arrived and had to be relocated to another room but it was painless. I made use of the fitness center which was actually pretty nice, especially compared to the average hotel fitness center. Plenty of tremills, free weights and machines. The outdoor pool area is nice although you are overlooking a private airport with constant flights from helicopters and small planes but you also can see docked boats, yachts & cruise ships. I ate at the hotels restaurant called Choices and the food was good. I also ate lunch from the poolside bar/restaurant one day and had the fish taco which was very good. The hotel has a decent size casino. The only real drawback to this hotel is that there is nothing surrounding this hotel at all. You will need to take a taxi to do anything.
reviews.title: Clean & Friendly

reviews.text: In general I must say that I had a good sejour!
reviews.title: Cleanliness and service in the room to be improved.

reviews.text: However, small details like dust, dirty windows, dirty corridor ect need to be improved!
reviews.title: Great if staying on business

reviews.text: I ask for a razor at the reception as I forgot mine and it took more than 4 hours to get me one!
reviews.title: excellent services
Not convenient for us pre cruise
reviews.text: I'm sure this is a nice business hotel, but for us it was just not convenient. We have been to San Juan many times and by far we feel the best location to stay is in Old San Juan. There is nothing within walking distance of this Sheraton. Your only choice for a restaurant other than the hotel is a Mexican restaurant across the street or a Pricey Brazilian steak house. No comparison to the selections in Old San Juan. This hotel does not give you the wonderful culture and flavor of San Juan.
The hotel is clean, modern and has a beautiful pool area, but unfortunately didn't work for us.
reviews.title: Family trip

reviews.text: Just got back from staying there. The rooms were very nice. Not far from the airport. You must either rent a car or pay for a taxi. We were a family of four and it was more economical to just rent a car. Parking fees were $16. Meals were a little pricey. We ate dinner an the Chinese Restaurant. It had great service and the prices were reasonable.
reviews.title: Needs Improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pro:1. The staff is really great. They bend over backward to help you. 2. Clean. 3. Comfortable.
reviews.title: Great rooms but no walking distance

reviews.text: Con: 1. Location is close to convention center, but no restaurants or shopping nearby.
reviews.title: Perfect Pre Cruise Hotel

reviews.text: The Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel and Casino is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed. I stayed at this hotel last year in February. Everything was fine, until my safe was broken into. I lost a nominal amount of money, and called security when i realized. The evening security people made out a report, and told us to come down to be reimbursed for the money. I was ready for bed at this time after a long day. So, I decided to address this in the morning. Big mistake, The female daytime manager, JR is terrible, has no customer service experience, and is downright rude. She made me wait in the lobby for more than an hour until she decided to make her way downstairs. After threatening to call the police, she finally returned my money. After writing a terrible review on SPG, she called me and offered me any amenities I would like upon our next visit.
reviews.title: Do not stay here.

reviews.text: So, I decided to go back because the location is good. After various emails back and forth finally she called me and asked what she could do to make our stay better. I was impressed, So, I was a bit over the top asking for an upgrade to a suite. She, of course, did not do this. Now, starwood guests are offered upgrades if one is available, so really I did not get anything more than was expected. I told her in an email that I would be arrriving at 1 am. She had no room available. Once I told the evening staff that I would be happy to pull out a blanket, and sleep on their couch, they amazingly found a room. They charged me for an extra day, saying that I arrived at 11:59 pm. My flight did not touch down until 11:47, and I checked my bags. The airport is more than 15 minutes away,so I could not have ever checked in at that time. Customer service is not something this hotel excels in. The first room, and the second "upgraded" room were dirty. There were stains on the carpeting, under the sink dirty. This is not a four or five star hotel. This is a two star hotel at best. Another thing that happened, which of course was accidental, was that when we were checking into our second room, when I put the key in, the room was occupied. I think you can imagine our horror, as well as the other guests horror. I can go on and on.
reviews.title: Friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The women at the front desk, especially A.S. is a very sarcastic nasty woman. She used an affected Puerto RIcan accident to let me know who the overall manager of the hotel is, and then implied i was stupid, since it is a very easy name. Yes, it is, if you speak proper English.
reviews.title: Great stay before our cruise

reviews.text: By the way, there is a very small blurb that says they are not responsible for anything left in their safes. So, if you have anything of value, I suggest you put it behind the front desk, in their safety deposit boxes.
reviews.title: Nice city hotel

reviews.text: A wonderful vacation, turned into a vacation from hell.
reviews.title: Great place to have fun

reviews.text: Sheraton is a cozy Hotel near San Juan Convention Center with a breathtaking view of San Juan Bay Area.
reviews.title: A nice place to visit

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel one night before our cruise. Our room was really clean and the view beautiful, but the location is far from attractions. If you stay at this hotel at the same time as people staying there before going on a cruise, make sure you make a reservation to eat breakfast downstairs at the restaurant as it is very busy. We had to wait 30 minutes to have a table. And it's very expensive for buffet (hot breakfast: 78$ for 3 people). If you want a good supper at a cheap price (10.95$ per person), we recommend eating at the Sizzler. It's a buffet with local food, just a 5 minute walk.
reviews.title: Very nice, quiet and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are currently staying at this hotel and will be checking out this morning. We arrived at 7:30 pm last night and it took almost an hour to check in. It appeared that the front desk staff does not know what they are doing. We have traveled almost around the world and have never spent an hour just to check into the hotel. The front desk claimed it took so long because of security measures they have to take. Is San Juan so dangerous that security takes an hour to verify you are who you say you are? Unlikely. The man who checked us in had to get two other people to help him with the computer and answer questions about how to check us in. There was of course a long line to check in, like at Disney World for the popular rides. People were complaining to each other. I have never seen anything like it. We are in the bar at the hotel which was good except a very loud party had started in another bar off the lobby. We could hardly speak to each other for all the loud music. Angel the bell boy wad very helpful with getting us to our room. He is a jewel in is hotel.
reviews.title: Overpriced additional fees and bad location!

reviews.text: We received a letter with our bill under our door this morning that said check out was at 11 am when the book in our room says check out is at noon. I called and was told the books had not been changed yet but we could have a noon checkout time. There was a $15 hotel service fee add to our bill, for what we have no idea. We did get a free bottle of water in our room. Maybe it is for the water.
reviews.title: Very good for business trips

reviews.text: We stayed here for night prior to a cruise. We will never stay here again. We will be going back to the Marriott here in San Juan. It is much nicer and easier to check in. Our last stay at the Marriott in San Juan, check in was under one minute.
reviews.title: Great Concierge!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton the night before meeting a cruise because the Hilton was booked solid. The bed was comfortable - nice pillows! - and the shower was pleasant. Our flight didn't get us to San Juan until 11pm, so we arrived late to the hotel and the lobby was very loud with music from the DJ in the adjacent bar - it was difficult to hear the desk clerk while checking in. But our room was quiet and in the morning we looked out the window to see the cruise ship waiting for us over at the docks. It's not a great location if you want to do some walking around old San Juan, but it served our purpose. The wait for breakfast the next morning was much longer than it should have been (there is a buffet, though, if you are in a hurry) - but the oatmeal was well worth the wait!
reviews.title: Decent enough night's sleep

reviews.text: I gave a second chance, but this was not a pleasant stay, and it was far from the usual Sheraton quality. Restaurant three days in a row took 45 minutes to bring breakfast, they apologize every time but do nothing to correct. Personnel at the door is really helpful and nice, most of the rest, don't really care much. Avoid this hotel, if you can.
reviews.title: Another terrible stay. Stay away

reviews.text: Tonight, I had a dinner with my best friend at Choices Rest. Our main waiter was Bianca, she was really nice and always was taking care of our experience at the restaurant. Rolando was the other waiter, he made us feel really pleased. He explained us every part of the menu and even when they had traffic, we didn't feel abandoned. The food was amazing and with a spectacular presentation. Gabriel came with two daiquiris for us, they were great as well. He was really friendly even when he was not our waiter. Finally, one of the managers named Elsie, asked us about the experience and thanked us for being there.
reviews.title: Excellente Customer Service!

reviews.text: It was one of the best dinners that I have had in a long time.
reviews.title: Expected A Lot More!

reviews.text: I stayed here on business this past week for four nights and brought my girlfriend along to enjoy the warm weather. I stayed here because I was working at the Convention Center, which is right across the street. Let me just say that I expected a whole lot more from this property being that it is rated a 4 star hotel. The hotel is new and it really is a very nice hotel. The pool deck is awesome with an infinity pool overlooking the bay and a small airport. The lobby and bar area nice as well. The rooms are just average. They are clean but just average. We stayed on the Starwood Preferred floor and not sure what was so preferred about it. The rooms didn't have any refrigerators and no bathrobes. The rooms have the bare minimum. I will say this, the beds are great. Had a very comfortable sleep. The main thing lacking at this hotel is customer service. All of the staff we encountered weren't friendly at all. They could careless you are staying there. There are a few dining options on site. Choices, China Club, and Texas De Brazil. Although all 3 are on site, you can only charge to your at Choices. This is the only hotel I've stayed at that offers dining options, but won't let you make any room charges. Anyways, Texas De Brazil (which is a chain) was the best of all. I would stay away from Choices. I'm used to paying hotel prices but this place is overpriced! Rude waitstaff and mediocre food. I would recommend going across the street and trying out Ficus restaurant. Great drinks and good tapas style food. Also tried room service one night. Took about an hour to get a simple dessert and of course that was way overpriced as well. The location of the hotel isn't great either. You definitely need a car to get around. A cab to Old San Juan will run you $15. I would definitely recommend renting a car if staying here. All in all, I would recommend staying elsewhere if visiting this area. If the customer service were to drastically improve here, I would consider staying again. You can get more bang for your buck at other hotels. We stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Isla Verde for a few nights as well and that was great! Read my review on that hotel as well.
reviews.title: Nice hotel. Terrible location.
More like a 2 star hotel...stay away
reviews.text: I recently visited the Sheraton with my boyfriend for a short getaway to just relax. We knew the location wasn't the best, but after reading reviews and seeing the star rating we were ok wi a cab to Old San Juan and a walk tithe beach.

Upon our arrival we checked into a room that had stained sheets and BUGS in it. I am not saying they were bed bugs, I don't know what hey were, but regardless I freaked. They switched us to a new room and AGAIN the bed had stained sheets. It was unbelievable, they were disgusting! Finally our third room appeared to have decent sheets and we settl our stuff and headed to the pool.
reviews.title: Is great if you have something in the Convention center

reviews.text: The pool was nice looking, but not that clean. I ordered a cocktail that claimed to have jimador silver and mango rum and the bartender proceeded to poor Jose gold and peach schnapps into the cup. Immediately I objected, clearly he misunderstood my order. When I questioned his use of those liquors, he got angry and argued with me, telling me they were the "same thing". After attempting to have a few drinks I decided i wasn't willing to pay $10 for something that wasn't what I ordered. He again argued, but agreed to replace the drink with something else. But on my next drink he seriously shorted me n the liquor.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Our first meal for room service was good, but took over an hour to arrive. It was .t even anything extravagant... Just soup salad and sandwich. However every meal that followed was awful. We ordered a CARIBBEAN JERK chicken wrap, which was just chicken smothered in yellow curry, not so Caribbean. Another time I asked if the burger was fresh ground beef or a frozen patty. The waitress lied to my face and then brought me a grayish brown hockey puck on a bun similar to what McDonalds might serve. The chicken in the quesadilla also didn't seem fresh.
reviews.title: nice property, poor food and service

reviews.text: We left each day by around 9 am and generally didn't return until after 3 or 4. Two out of four days we returned our room was still dirty and without fresh towels. There is nothing worse than coming back from a rainforest hike all sweaty and not being able to shower. When the room was cleaned, they didn't do a sufficient job. Most likely the hotel is understaffed, so I am sympathetic to the maids, however we still should not have been inconvenienced because of it.
reviews.title: One night only

aka: Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel San Juan
description: Superbly situated amidst the Puerto Rico Convention Center facing the Bay of San Juan, our hotel will be just 10 minutes from the international airport and 5 minutes from historic Old San Juan.
